Unit 1, VPRS 1199 Chief Commissioner's inward correspondence, VA 724 Victoria Police, Public Record Office, Victoria.

div.p:
Transcribed 19.11.92. To proof.
Wednesday. [25 November 1857]
See dates of inscriptions.

Would there be any impropriety in asking for four Police Constables to be placed in the Botanical Gardens on the afternoons of Friday & Saturday next, during the progress of a fancy bazaar in aid of the South Yarra Church of England Schools.

If it is asking for what is unusual of course you will not grant my request but the Superintendent of the Gardens asked me this morning if I would speak to you on the matter — and I imagine that wherever any number of persons are likely to be collected together in one spot, you always like to have one, or two constables

The Ladies who are managing this affair, will take care that the Constables receive some refreshment if you think proper to send them.
On 25 November, MacMahon instructed: 'Inspr McCulloch will be so good as to furnish these Constables as required — If he cannot spare them, Mr Cooke will supply the number on application'. McCulloch noted on 27 November: ''Attended to'.
